text: High tide at Mevagissey this morning. Approx 450mm of additional sea level due to surge from the weather & wave action onto the South coast.  Great to see most properties had heeded @EnvAgency flood warnings and installed their flood boards to stop the sea entering the buildings https://t.co/4mbWArOY9E

@moogfood @Matthew_Wright @EnvAgency Incredible amount of fish. And to think there was no C&R back then and the river was netted and poached every night on an industrial scale, yet the fish still ran in huge numbers. The rod return was about 600 fish this year.

#floodalerts in place in the #northwest, visit @TheFloodHub lots more info here  https://t.co/0vdWv0UvpD
@EnvAgencyNW #Floodaware https://t.co/gO2RlQhtYj
We're keeping an eye out for Wandle pollution and have reported this incident in the parallel channel at Bennett's Hole Local Nature Reserve yesterday to @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/EL54rWZ0UT

I received the permit for this site from @EnvAgency. The thousands of tonnes of waste bales stored on the south west area of the site are not on a permitted area.  Weak and ineffective regulation. https://t.co/gEbGCFM4CW

text: @Matthew_Wright @cerivthomas @EnvAgency Matthew. Best river south of the border for many a year. At its peak, 10,000 fish at its peak. The aggregate of marginal losses so many factors that combine to destroy an ecosystem. We are fighting back though, much work to do. https://t.co/6IJTUFWRki

@EnvAgency responded to my FOI request. They sent a catalogue of weak and ineffective regulation. 2 years of fires, TCM breaches, odour issues, non compliance with FPP and OPRA scores in the hundreds. How bad does it have to be before you put a stop to this? https://t.co/HnvIlz2c9h
